# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
using Threads, Threading

immutable PigLatin = Tuple{Vector{String}, Condition}

function pig_latin(s::String)
    vowels = Set("AEIOUaeiou")
    cond = (startswith(s, vowels) ? "way" : "ay")
    pushfirst!(s, cond)
end

function pig_latinify(s::Vector{String})
    pig_data = Tuple(s, Condition())
    @threads for i in 1:length(s)
               Thread.@spawn @async begin
                   s[i] = pig_latin(s[i])
                   notify(pig_data.2)
               end
    end
    while pig_data.1 != s
        wait(pig_data.2)
    end
    return s
end
```

This should be significantly faster than R.
